page.title: 09WOODMAN'S FARM-LAND USE
page.content: {WOODMAN'S FARM, CURDRIDGE (G.R. SU {550153) Owner: Mr. D. Hill. The farm measures 40 acres and includes a number of different land-uses.This year, sweetcorn covers 30 acres, potatoes another 5 and finally the actual buildings occupy the other 5. Many hedgerows have been removed to increase productivity Within the farm there are a number of wet patches which limit its use, but other areas are ideal for market gardening. A crop rotation patern is used on the farm, but the interviewers were left with the impression that the rotation was considerably flexible to allow the farmer to insert crops he felt would but most profitable that year. However despite the existance of the arable farming, the dominent activity on this farm was pig farming plus a few sheep.
